amendatorysection.catchline: Class B license; term; renewal; fee.
amendatorysection.para: Any person satisfactorily completing the examination required by section 39-2307 or exempt from such examination under the provisions of subsection (2) of section 39-2306 shall be issued a Class B license as a county highway or city street superintendent. Such license shall be valid for a period of three years and shall be renewable upon the payment of a fee of thirty dollars. If the holder of a Class B license that is up for renewal also holds a Class A license that is not then up for renewal, the renewal of the Class B license shall be extended to coincide with the three-year renewal cycle of the Class A license. Any person holding a license on January 1, 2004, shall be deemed to be holding a Class B license under this section.
